intro: Galium aparine subsp. tenerum, commonly known as sticky willow herb, is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its hairy stems and small, white flowers. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are often dispersed by animals. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, serrated edge. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
